revised_title: Using Furze for River Bank Fencing
tldr: The author, David Wark, describes the use of furze bushes to effectively and cheaply fence river banks, preventing soil erosion and the need for expensive stone-work in building harbours. Furze is also compared to the brushwood used in Holland for sea-dikes, showing its effectiveness in detaining collected earth.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Erosion Control
